PIONEER EXPERIENCES: A GENERAL QUESTIONNAIRE

NO. 2

ANSWERING THE QUESTIONNAIRE

A word of explanation to the person

It is difficult to prepare a general questionnaire in places like this because no individual who is asked to answer it has exactly the same experiences as another.

Some of the questions here will not apply to your experiences or may prove impossible for you to answer, so don't worry about leaving blank spaces. Use "N/A."

The answers of people like these is not sufficient space to answer the questions.

This questionnaire is intended for persons who lived in western Canada before 1914, and may be answered by anyone who has personal experience of the pioneer heritage to give details, or describe particular events, if they help to answer the questions.

If more than one member of the family can answer the questions, they should write them on separate sheets or apply for a separate questionnaire.

Saskatchewan Archives Questionnaire No. 1, entitled "Pioneer Pilot: What Did Western Canadian Pioneers Really Do?" is still being circulated. If you have not already answered this, and would be willing to do so, please put a check mark here ( ).

Saskatchewan Archives questionnaires on other subjects will be prepared at a later date. Some of these are listed below. Please mark the ones you would be willing to answer.

9. How did you learn about the West? Through other people? Reading about it from a school friend who had previously gone to Edmonton.
11. What did your friends and relatives think of your decision to come to Saskatoon?

Canadian Air Lines had a very good reputation, and I thought it was a very good opportunity.

12. Did you travel by yourself or with a party (family, friends or other group)?

I traveled alone to Saskatoon by train.

13. What means of transportation did you use?

Train and bus.

14. How did you settle or take up land? As a homesteader, squatter, etc.

By my employment in the organization of the Saskatchewan Railways.

15. Where did you first stay when you arrived in Saskatoon?

From Edmonton to Prince Albert.

16. Where did you settle or take up land? As a homesteader, squatter, etc.

By my employment in the organization of the Saskatchewan Railways.

17. Mention any other places where you have lived since coming to Saskatchewan.

None.

18. How did you earn a living before coming to Western Canada? How old are you now?

In the garage business as a garage mechanic and in charge of the garage and auto repair shop.
